decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to utilize the aggressive nature of dinosaurs to overwhelm the opponent. By using cards like Commune with Dinosaurs to search for key creatures, and cards like Abrade to control the board, this deck aims to establish dominance early on. With powerful dinosaurs like Regisaur Alpha and Ghalta, Primal Hunger, this deck can quickly build a threatening board presence. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Struggle / Survive and Rekindling Phoenix provide additional versatility and resilience. Overall, this deck focuses on fast, aggressive gameplay with a focus on dinosaur synergy.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board while setting up for the win condition of bringing back creatures from the graveyard with God-Pharaoh's Gift. By using cards like Refurbish and Strategic Planning, the deck aims to quickly get the artifact enchantment into play. In addition to controlling spells like Cast Out and Champion of Wits, the deck also includes card draw options like Chart a Course and Search for Azcanta to help dig for key pieces. This strategy allows for a powerful late-game presence with powerful creatures like Angel of Invention.

The main focus of this Aggro Sultai deck is to efficiently ramp up mana and play aggressive creatures with powerful abilities. The deck includes cards that boost the power of creatures, generate energy for various effects, provide protection for key creatures, and remove opponent's threats. The synergy between cards like Winding Constrictor and Walking Ballista, along with the ability to quickly flip Hadana's Climb for a powerful finish, allows the deck to apply pressure early and maintain momentum throughout the game.

Utilize powerful creatures like The Scarab God and Gonti, Lord of Luxury, along with disruptive spells like Fatal Push and Essence Scatter, to control the board and pressure the opponent. Support these threats with card advantage engines like Glint-Sleeve Siphoner and Champion of Wits, while using Field of Ruin to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck also includes some counter magic like Commit / Memory and Torrential Gearhulk for additional control options. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early while disrupting the opponent's game plan to secure victory.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on beefing up creatures with +1/+1 counters using Winding Constrictor and Hadana's Climb, while also utilizing energy counters to power up cards like Glint-Sleeve Siphoner and Servant of the Conduit. The deck also includes removal spells like Vraska's Contempt and Fatal Push to deal with threats, as well as card draw with Jadelight Ranger. Overall, the strategy revolves around quickly building a strong board presence and overwhelming opponents with versatile creatures and powerful effects.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on maximizing +1/+1 counters and efficient creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By strategically using cards like Winding Constrictor and Verdurous Gearhulk, combined with removal spells like Vraska's Contempt and Fatal Push, the deck aims to establish board dominance and close out games early. Utilizing creatures with strong abilities like Walking Ballista and Scrapheap Scrounger, along with boosting them with Rishkar, Peema Renegade, this deck excels at putting pressure on the opponent and maintaining a strong board presence throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly swarm the board with aggressive creatures and apply pressure to the opponent's life total. It utilizes a combination of creatures with strong abilities and efficient removal spells to maintain board presence and push through damage. The deck also includes resilient threats that are difficult to deal with, such as Rekindling Phoenix and Carnage Tyrant. By curving out with efficient creatures and powerful finishers, the deck aims to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This Sultai Aggro deck focuses on using powerful creatures like Glint-Sleeve Siphoner, Jadelight Ranger, and Bristling Hydra, supported by cards like Vraska's Contempt and Fatal Push for removal. The deck aims to quickly build up a board presence with the help of cards like Winding Constrictor and Hadana's Climb to close out the game before the opponent has a chance to respond. The deck also includes Blossoming Defense to protect its key creatures and ensure they can deal maximum damage to the opponent.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to maintain board control through a variety of removal spells and counterspells, while also utilizing cards like Glint-Sleeve Siphoner and Champion of Wits to draw cards and generate card advantage. The deck also aims to stabilize the board with cards like Liliana, Death's Majesty and The Scarab God, while utilizing Torrential Gearhulk to flashback powerful spells. Overall, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent through efficient removal and card advantage.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using cards like Walking Ballista, Minister of Inquiries, and Champion of Wits to disrupt your opponent's strategy. By utilizing cards like Refurbish and God-Pharaoh's Gift, you can bring back powerful creatures like Angel of Invention from the graveyard to overwhelm your opponent. Strategic Planning and Chart a Course help you dig for the pieces you need while cards like Cast Out and Search for Azcanta provide additional utility. Field of Ruin helps deal with troublesome lands while Glacial Fortress and Irrigated Farmland provide the mana base for the deck.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays with a mix of creatures and removal spells to maintain pressure on the opponent. It uses efficient threats like Heart of Kiran and Scrapheap Scrounger to deal damage quickly, while also utilizing cards like Unlicensed Disintegration and Abrade to clear the way for attacks. The inclusion of versatile cards like Walking Ballista and Hazoret the Fervent allows for adaptability in different situations. By combining strong creatures with removal spells and a solid mana base, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through consistent damage output.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the God-Pharaoh's Gift to reanimate powerful creatures from the graveyard, such as Angel of Invention and Champion of Wits, to gain control of the game. The deck includes cards like Refurbish and Strategic Planning to help get the Gift into play quickly, while also running control elements like Cast Out and Search for Azcanta to manage the board. The deck aims to out-value the opponent by recurring threats and maintaining card advantage through efficient card draw and selection.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game using cards like Search for Azcanta, Cast Out, and Field of Ruin to disrupt your opponent's strategy. The key combo of this deck revolves around using God-Pharaoh's Gift to bring back powerful creatures from the graveyard, like Walking Ballista and Champion of Wits. Strategic Planning and Refurbish help to set up this combo quickly, while Chart a Course provides card draw to find the pieces you need. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and maintain control of the board.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using cards like Search for Azcanta and Cast Out to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The main goal is to get God-Pharaoh's Gift onto the battlefield, allowing you to reanimate powerful creatures like Angel of Invention and Champion of Wits. Refurbish and Strategic Planning help to quickly get the Gift into play, while Minister of Inquiries and Champion of Wits provide card advantage and fill your graveyard. Walking Ballista and Fairgrounds Warden offer additional ways to control the board and protect your key pieces.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan through a mix of aggressive creatures and powerful control spells. The goal is to apply pressure early with efficient creatures like Glint-Sleeve Siphoner and Champion of Wits, while using removal spells like Fatal Push and Vraska's Contempt to deal with threats. The deck also utilizes powerful late-game threats such as The Scarab God and Torrential Gearhulk to close out games. The mana base is designed to support both the aggressive and controlling aspects of the deck.

This deck focuses on efficiently using +1/+1 counters with cards like Winding Constrictor and Hadana's Climb to pump up its creatures and put pressure on the opponent quickly. It also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Vraska's Contempt to deal with threats and keep the board clear. With a mix of creatures that can grow in size and powerful finishers like The Scarab God and Carnage Tyrant, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and establish dominance on the battlefield.
